results.title: End of the Line
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. Fleeing from town, a small child finds himself hiding in a seemingly deserted railway station. One day he is crossing the tracks when a train come hurtling towards him. A beautifully photographed film, imbued with feelings of isolation and loneliness.

results.title: Smoking ad
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. A student exercise in the creation of an advertisment suitable for television. This short animated work highlights the health dangers related to smoking.

group_siblings.title: The good, the bad and the animated

results.title: Can you stop the music?
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.This documentary asks local councils, residential associations and live music venue operators to give their views on the impact that inner-city gentrification has had on the live music scene in Melbourne. The once strong scene has seen a decline in the number of venues due to the increasing demand for inner city living.

results.title: The good, the bad and the animated
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. This animated homage to Sergio Leone has the classic western ‘shootout’, between a cowboy in black and a cowboy in white. This town ain’t big enough for the both of them.

results.title: Screen Battle Royale
results.brief_description: 4 short works from participants in the Screen Education digital mixing and animation program for Secondary Schools. Part of the ACMI 2004: Australian Culture Now suite of programs. Groups include Art Start groups 1 and 2, Kingswood College and Belgrave Heights Christian School.</

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Thrownness
results.brief_description:
Two people are thrown into a strange, mysterious place where nothing is as it appears to be and where the relation between cause and effect is never stable. As they explore their surroundings they discover that space, time and themselves are elements of a carefully constructed illusion. Thrownness has been inspired by Matthew Arnold’s poem, ‘Dover Beach’ and philosopher Martin Heidegger. Arnold’s poem of 1867 has surprising contemporary relevance in a time where ‘ignorant armies clash by night’. The romantic photography reminiscent of 1950 Technicolor films, fantastical sets inspired by Fellini’s films and the use of old style in-camera effects create an intriguing, magical aesthetic.

As viewers Thrownness asks us to consider our role in creating narrative coherence through our understanding of cinematic traditions and visual language. The story has an integral, essential and evolving relationship with the elements that create it. The effect of this is the generation of an unexpected alternative narrative which reveals the complex artifice that is the film language.

results.title: Jirrupin Bunggul 'Happy Dance'
results.brief_description: Winner of the ‘Make a stamp come alive’ category of Screen It! This cool little work combines a thumping dance track with animation of the artwork depicted on an Australian stamp entitled ‘Aboriginal Culture: Music and Dance’. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description: Highly commended entry into the “Make a stamp come alive” category of Screen It! This film recounts the story of famous revolt in Ballarat and the subsequent discovery of gold. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Freedom of the Boomerang
results.brief_description: Highly commended ” make a stamp come alive” entry to Screen It! A man visiting a post office unwittingly unleashes a magical boomerang into the world. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
